INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: [Date] CC Referred Physician: Dr. Smith

INDICATION FOR OPERATION
[REDACTED] is a 57-year-old male who presents with airway narrowing.

The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.

CONSENT
Obtained before the procedure. The nature, purpose, risks, benefits and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified
Bronchus intermedius bronchial stenosis

PROCEDURE
Therapeutic aspiration (initial episode) (CPT 31645)
Destruction of tumor OR relief of stenosis by any method other than excision (e.g. laser therapy, cryotherapy) (CPT 31641)
Balloon dilation of Bronchus intermedius orifice

ATTENDING Dr. Kim
ASSISTANT Dr. Garcia
SUPPORT STAFF RN: Emily RT: John

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia

MONITORING
Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION
Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; Electrocautery (knife); Elation balloon (6/7/8).

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None
COMPLICATIONS None

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL
After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Patient Position [Supine]

Initial Airway Inspection
Bronchus intermedius orifice was significantly narrowed. Prior to treatment, the affected airway was noted to be 20% patent.

Therapeutic Aspiration
Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the proximal airways from mucus.

Bronchus intermedius Intervention
Endobronchial obstruction at the BI orifice was treated with the following modalities:

Electrocautery: Using Electrocautery knife (setting endoI 4, 4, 1), radial cuts were made for a duration of 4 seconds.

Balloon Dilation: A 6/7/8 Elation balloon was used to perform dilation to 8 mm at the Bronchus intermedius orifice. Total of 4 inflations were performed with a dilation time of 45 seconds each.

Results
After treatment, the airway was 95% patent.

Conclusion
The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications. At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMENS
None

Significant BI stenosis treated with Electrocautery radial cuts and balloon dilation; airway patency improved from 20% to 95%.

Next Step: 3 weeks follow-up bronchoscopy (order placed with level 2).

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: [Date] CC Referred Physician: Dr. Bowers

INDICATION FOR OPERATION
[REDACTED] is a 58-year-old female who presents with airway narrowing.

The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.

CONSENT
Obtained before the procedure. The nature, purpose, risks, benefits and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified
Bronchus intermedius bronchial stenosis

PROCEDURE
Therapeutic aspiration (initial episode) (CPT 31645)
Destruction of tumor OR relief of stenosis by any method other than excision (e.g. laser therapy, cryotherapy) (CPT 31641)
Balloon dilation of Bronchus intermedius orifice

ATTENDING Dr. Patel
ASSISTANT Dr. White
SUPPORT STAFF RN: David RT: Lisa

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia

MONITORING
Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION
Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; Cryotherapy (probe); CRE balloon (12/13/15).

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None
COMPLICATIONS None

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL
After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Patient Position [Supine]

Initial Airway Inspection
Bronchus intermedius orifice was significantly narrowed. Prior to treatment, the affected airway was noted to be 10% patent.

Therapeutic Aspiration
Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the proximal airways from mucus.

Bronchus intermedius Intervention
Endobronchial obstruction at the BI orifice was treated with the following modalities:

Cryotherapy: Using Cryotherapy probe (setting n/a), freeze-thaw cycles were made for a duration of 4 seconds.

Balloon Dilation: A 12/13/15 CRE balloon was used to perform dilation to 13 mm at the Bronchus intermedius orifice. Total of 4 inflations were performed with a dilation time of 30 seconds each.

Results
After treatment, the airway was 100% patent.

Conclusion
The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications. At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMENS
None

IMPRESSION / PLAN
58-year-old female who presented for bronchoscopy for airway narrowing.
Significant BI stenosis treated with Cryotherapy freeze-thaw cycles and balloon dilation; airway patency improved from 10% to 100%.

Next Step: 2 weeks follow-up bronchoscopy (order placed with level 2).
